cTOST 1.1.0

Package index

Main TOST Functions

Core functions for Two One-Sided Tests

tost()
Two One-Sided Tests (TOST) for (Bio)Equivalence Assessment
ctost()
Finite Sample Adjustment for Average (Bio)Equivalence Assessment
atost()
The alpha-TOST Corrective Procedure for (Bio)Equivalence Testing
dtost()
The delta-TOST Corrective Procedure for (Bio)Equivalence Testing

Quantile Equivalence Tests

Tests for quantile-based bioequivalence

qtost()
Quantile equivalence testing procedures

Extended TOST Methods

Extended approaches for equivalence testing

xtost()
Finite Sample Adjusted (Bio)Equivalence Testing of the xTOST Corrective Procedure

Multivariate Methods

Equivalence tests for multivariate data

Power and Sample Size

Functions for study planning and power analysis

power_TOST()
Power Function of Univariate TOST
power_xTOST()
Power function of the xTOST Corrective Procedure
power_qTOST_MC()
Power calculation for quantile TOST using Monte Carlo simulation
power_xTOST_mv()
Power function for multivariate xTOST procedure
power_TOST_MC_mv()
Power function of univariate or multivariate TOST using Monte Carlo integration
size_TOST()
Size of Univariate TOST
size_xTOST()
Size function of the xTOST Corrective Procedure

Alpha Calibration

Functions for significance level adjustment

get_alpha_star()
Compute Adjusted Significance Level (Alpha Star) for Univariate TOST
get_alpha_TOST()
Get alpha star of the alpha-TOST Corrective Procedure
get_alpha_qTOST_MC()
Get alpha star for quantile TOST
get_alpha_TOST_MC_mv()
Get alpha star for multivariate TOST

Comparison Functions

Compare different TOST approaches

compare_to_tost()
Comparison of a Corrective Procedure to the results of the Two One-Sided Tests (TOST) in Univariate Settings
compare_to_qtost()
Comparison of a Corrective Procedure to the Results of the Quantile Two One-Sided Tests (qTOST) in Single Quantile Setting

Visualization and Output

Plot and print methods

plot(<tost>)
Plot confidence intervals for one or more `tost` or `mtost` objects
print(<tost>)
Print Results of (Bio)Equivalence Assessment in Univariate Settings
print(<qtost>)
Print Results of (Bio)Equivalence testing in Single Quantile Setting.
print(<mtost>)
Print Results of (Bio)Equivalence Assessment in Multivariate Settings
print(<m_qtost>)
Print Results of (Bio)Equivalence testing in Two Quantiles Setting.
ci()
Confidence Interval for Univariate TOST

Datasets

Example datasets included in the package

skin
Log transformed cutaneous delivery of econazole (ECZ) from bioequivalent products on porcine skin
ticlopidine
????????

Simulation Tools

Functions for data simulation

simulate_data()
Simulate data from the canonical form of the univariate average equivalence problem
